thread.title: Dublin named cheapest city for cultural tourismTravelandtourworld.com
thread.title_full: Dublin named cheapest city for cultural tourismTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Dublin named cheapest city for cultural tourismTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Dublin named cheapest city for cultural tourism Published on : Wednesday, August 26, 2015
A survey conducted recently has named Dublin the cheapest city for cultural tourism. Dublin was cheaper than other popular cultural destinations such as Prague, Budapest and Warsaw, which had previously been touted as cheap cities for cultural tourism.
The report was conducted by The Post Office Travel Money on 16 cities in Europe and New York, comparing the prices of the city’s major cultural attractions that tourists would visit.
The sites chosen for Dublin were the National Museum, National Gallery and Trinity College’s Old Library (pictured) and Book of Kells exhibit, as well as theatre events held in the city.
The report put the cost of attending all these sites and events in Dublin at €100 while a similar outing would cost €397 in London, €342 in Paris and €680 in New York, the most expensive of all the cities.
